speaker: Shvetadwip Chowdhury
transcript: Um, yeah, we're good to go. So if I open up the meeting slides, um, I guess we have a few questions that we have to answer.

speaker: Brad Smith
transcript: Um, can I just, uh, my name is Bradley Smith. I'm one of the facilitators and and let me introduce Brian Pogue there who's also one of the facilitators.

annotations.explain or define term or concept: Brad Smith is introducing himself and Brian Pogue as facilitators, which explains their role in the meeting.
annotations.acknowledge contribution: Brad Smith is introducing Brian Pogue, acknowledging his presence and role as a facilitator.

annotations.None: This utterance is a simple greeting and does not fit any of the codes in the codebook.

speaker: Brad Smith
transcript: Um, just to give a little bit of structure here, we're supposed to do short introductions. We're also supposed to take one minute to write down our thoughts that if there's some dead space later on, we'll return to them. And we're also supposed to identify a reporter that can talk back to the larger group. Just fill in that slide. It's really a little bit of work and I would advise anybody that it's it's a benefit because you get identified as somebody that's interested in this topic.

annotations.explain or define term or concept: The speaker explains the structure of the meeting, including introductions, writing down thoughts, and identifying a reporter, to provide clarity on the meeting's process.
annotations.assign task: The speaker assigns the task of filling in the slide to the participants.
annotations.encourage participation: The speaker encourages participation by advising that filling in the slide is a benefit because it identifies them as someone interested in the topic.

speaker: Brian Pogue
transcript: Yeah, I guess does anybody want to be the reporter?

speaker: Brian Pogue
transcript: But but not for an hour, like we have an hour of discussion. We fill it out at the end.
